Trial by Fire.name: Trial by Fire
Trial by Fire.blurb: Every few seconds, Gangplank's melee strike will set his opponent on fire.
Trial by Fire.description: Innate: Gangplank periodically empowers his next basic attack to burn the target, dealing 55 − 225 (based on level) (+ 100% bonus AD)  bonus true damage over 2.5 seconds, ticking every 0.25 seconds.  Turrets receive 50% reduced damage.
Trial by Fire.description2: If Gangplank successfully hits a target with Trial by Fire, he gains  30% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds. Destroying a  Powder Keg resets the  cooldown for Trial by Fire and grants its  bonus movement speed.
Trial by Fire.description3: Trial by Fire cannot be applied with  Parrrley or  Powder Keg.
Trial by Fire.notes: * Unlike most  damage over time debuffs, reapplying Trial by Fire before a previous application has run out will stack the full damage, instead of just refreshing the duration.

Parrrley.name: Parrrley
Parrrley.blurb: Shoots target, plundering Gold for each enemy unit killed.
Parrrley.description: Active: Gangplank shoots the target enemy with his pistol, dealing  physical damage and applying on-hit effects.
Parrrley.description2: Parrrley can  critically strike for (100% +  25%) AD bonus physical damage.
Parrrley.description3: If Parrrley kills the target, Gangplank plunders  gold and  Silver Serpents, the latter of which can be spent to upgrade  Cannon Barrage.
Parrrley.notes:
*  On-hit effects that deal area of effect damage will allow Parrrley to plunder from every enemy killed. This includes enemies killed by Gangplank's  Powder Keg's when activated by Parrrley.
 Parrrley doesn't count as a basic attack for  Guinsoo's Rageblade.

Remove Scurvy.name: Remove Scurvy
Remove Scurvy.blurb: Eats citrus to cure crowd control effects and restore Health.
Remove Scurvy.description: Active: Gangplank consumes a large quantity of citrus fruit,  cleansing himself from all  crowd control and  healing himself.
Remove Scurvy.notes:
* Remove Scurvy only removes crowd control debuffs (with the exception of  nearsight), so it cannot remove:
  Ignite's damage over time
  Exhaust's damage reduction
  Airborne crowd control effects (pull, knockback, knockup...)
  Malefic Visions
 Yet it is one of the few abilities that can remove  suppression.
  Nether Grasp and  Infinite Duress will still damage Gangplank even if he moves away.

Powder Keg.name: Powder Keg
Powder Keg.blurb: Gangplank uncovers a powder keg at target location. If he attacks it, it explodes, spreading the attack's damage to enemies in the area, slowing them.
Powder Keg.description: Passive: Gangplank periodically stocks a Powder Keg, up to a maximum of 3.
Powder Keg.description2: Active: Gangplank places a Powder Keg at the target location for 25 seconds, which connects to other nearby Powder Kegs with overlapping explosion radii.
Powder Keg.description3: Gangplank and his enemies can attack the Powder Keg with basic attacks, dealing 1 damage per hit. Gangplank may also shoot the barrel with Parrrley. If Gangplank scores the killing blow, it explodes, also triggering a chain reaction that explodes nearby connected kegs. If killed by an enemy, the keg is safely dismantled.
Powder Keg.description4: An exploding keg deals the attack's damage to all nearby enemies, plus bonus physical damage against  champions, ignoring 40% of their armor, as well as  slowing them for 2 seconds. Enemies can only be damaged once per chain.
Powder Keg.notes:
* Placed barrels do not grant  vision.
 An exploding Powder Keg will splash  Parrrley bonus damage, and will also be modified if the attack critically strikes.
 An exploding Powder Keg's damage is not increased by most attack effects from runes or items, such as  Blade of the Ruined King or  Wit's End. There is a notable exception, however: the bonus damage from  Sheen (and its upgrades) will be splashed to all targets.
 The Powder Keg is classified as being hit for the purposes of triggering effects such as  Tiamat with the effects centered on the keg.
 Powder Keg applies spell effects.

Cannon Barrage.name: Cannon Barrage
Cannon Barrage.blurb: Gangplank signals his ship to bombard an area, slowing and damaging enemies.
Cannon Barrage.description: Active: Gangplank signals his ship off-shore to fire upon the target area for 8 seconds, calling down 12 waves of cannonballs in clusters of 3 every 2 seconds, and  revealing it for the duration. Each wave deals  magic damage to all enemies within the area and  slows them by 30% for 0.5 seconds.
Cannon Barrage.description2: Gangplank can purchase upgrades for his ship in the store at the cost of 500  Silver Serpents each, which improve Cannon Barrage:
Cannon Barrage.leveling2:
Magic Damage Per Wave:
40 / 55 / 70 / 85 / 100 (+ 10% AP)
Magic Damage Per Cluster:
120 / 165 / 210 / 255 / 300 (+ 30% AP)
Cannon Barrage.description3: Death's Daughter: An initial cannonball lands in the center of the barrage, dealing a cluster's worth of true damage to all enemies it hits and  slowing them by 60% for 1.5 seconds.
Cannon Barrage.leveling3:
Total Magic Damage:
480 / 660 / 840 / 1020 / 1200 (+ 120% AP)
Total Magic Damage withFire at Will:
720 / 990 / 1260 / 1530 / 1800 (+ 180% AP)
Maximum Mixed Total Damage withFire at Will and Death's Daughter:
840 / 1155 / 1470 / 1785 / 2100 (+ 210% AP)
Cannon Barrage.description4: Raise Morale: The barrage grants allies  30% bonus movement speed while they are inside the area, persisting for 2 seconds after leaving it.
Cannon Barrage.description5: Fire at Will: Cannon Barrage fires  6 additional waves    2 additional clusters   over its duration.
Cannon Barrage.notes: * Cannon Barrage's slow lingers for 0.25 seconds after affected enemies leave the target area.
